Reviews.Title: “Avoid this place”
Reviews.Author: Emmefong
Reviews.Content: I regretted not reading the reviews before going to this hotel. I paid 100 pounds for 2 nights. I'm fine with the tiny room. However, the sink was falling apart. The floor squeaked when I stepped on it. The woman at the reception was rude. When I asked for the WIFI password, she ignored me and carried on chatting on the phone. I waited at the reception till she was done and she gave me a piece of paper with the password and asked me to "sort it out" myself. By the way, it was the wrong password. She told me off when I looked at the brochures in front of the reception. She said "Hey, I'm talking to you, give me the room keys before you go out!" This hotel may be a short walk away from the tube but there are many more around the area. I've stayed in other hotels in London and I could get other cheaper and better options.

Reviews.Title: “Why all this hate?”
Reviews.Author: LecceFabio
Reviews.Content: As a young man coming from a hostel, I didn't want to get into a Ritz Hotel. So I was glad to find good and friendly people at the reception, a room enough clean and a good shower and toilet. It was easy to reach the underground station and the bus stops, so my permanence in London was quiet and productive. I'm sure most of the people here complaining will go on it, even at Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION, BUT DO NOT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: tsarkoye
Reviews.Content: Located a short walk from Earl's Court underground. The rooms are very small and the beds are not comfortable. The bathroom was obviously not cleaned before we checked in - there was a used shampoo packet and a hair rubber band on the ground. The worst part, however, was that we returned from a play in the West End to get in and the front door was locked. The key doesn't open the front door, just the room. I had to ring the bell and wake up the hotel "landlord" (there is no real front desk) to let us in. How much does it really cost to change the lock on the front door? Of course there is no elevator...and it's close enough to the station that you can hear the trains.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but nothing else to recommend it.”
Reviews.Author: ActasifDorset
Reviews.Content: Two nights were quite enough. The room we were in was very small the only extra apart from the bedding was one small towel between two and liquid soap in the bijou ensuite. Our credit card was whisked away which still worries us although the bill was OK. There was a TV in the room precariously placed and with reception so poor you couldn't watch it. (Hasn't London gone digital yet?) I was glad we travelled light as there was so little space and I wouldn't want to carry a heavy case up the steep stairs. When I enquired about the tea and coffee I was directed to a small kitchen & told to help myself. One look was enough, we decided to forego the coffee! The only plus was the location, close to Earls Court underground and within easy walking distance of the Museums. I was glad they didn't provide breakfast as the places nearby were very good and well priced so we didn't have to spend much time there.

Reviews.Title: “Should be so much better for the money”
Reviews.Author: brightstarHampshire
Reviews.Content: First of all this was booked last minute. It cost £70 for a double room. Sure you could get so much more for your money though. The rooms are clean, though are in a really tatty state, the window in a room didn't even shut or lock! The doors are also shut at midnight, with no other means of acsess! So don't plan to stay out late! The staff were friendly and not rude to us as some people have reported. and we were able to check in early which was a huge bonus. No coffee or tea in the rooms though, just a horriable kitchen, with mainly McDonalds suger n milk cartons to use! All in all wouldn't stay here again, im sure you can get much better for your money. Great location, no real parking though.

Reviews.Title: “The worst place I've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Brendan3838
Reviews.Content: I have read some positive comments on this place that come up on top on this website they are written by a connected party or someone on drugs, the lower down comments are correct, it's an absolute dive. I dont know how it can be classified as a hotel, don't be misled by the grand name.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and friendly...”
Reviews.Author: Hennagirl
Reviews.Content: I stay at Regency Court Hotel often when I attend conferences at the Earls Court Exhibition Court...It feels like 'home away from home'! The exhibition is one minute walk from the hotel. The staff know me well and are superb. Often I book directly or I just walk in and they always find room for me and treat me like family. There is no elevator at the hotel but that is OK. The location is excellent and their buget room rates are good. It really is a clean friendly place. Planning on bringing my family next time!

Reviews.Title: “Worst ever”
Reviews.Author: DoZo1971
Reviews.Content: Worst hotel we ever seen. You couldn't imagine that these things exist. We decided not to stay, even though we were charged for the full four nights. Nothing we could do about it, because as far as the contract goes, you can't get a refund after a reservation. There are plenty of nice hotels in the direct neighbourhood.

Reviews.Title: “Scam”
Reviews.Author: eightMT
Reviews.Content: We were absolutely scammed at this hotel. We were charged for a room with a bathroom (which had the toilet taped shut and no shower). My friend got sick one night and vomited. Since the there was no where else to go, she threw-up outside the window. While we were out the next day, the manager went into the room and confiscated our belongings, including our passports. He refused to return them to us until we paid 100 pounds for the damage, which was a few specks on the side of the wall that could easily be taken off with a hose. When I tried to politely negotiate he became very aggressive and a few male guests had to come to our aid. Absolutely do not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “The worst 'hotel' ever”
Reviews.Author: AP24
Reviews.Content: Never in all my years have I experienced a stay like this one. The entire building should be condemned. There was basic filth EVERYWHERE. People were smoking cigs all over the hotel - elevator, stairs, hallway, hotel foyer. Everything smelt like smoke. The staff is basically worthless. Then just for laughes they are rude. Entering the room almost made me cry. The carpet, walls, floor, bed - everything was old , dirty and pretty much disgusting. The bathroom is shared and in the hallway. After my first night of sleep, on the rock they said was a mattress, I went to shower off the animals that had probably cuddled with me the night before and almost stepped into a large pile of vomit on the floor. All and all It was the most pitiful excuse for a 'hotel' I have been unfortunate enough to stay in. It attempted to ruin my stay in England. Next time - I would rather spend my money and sleep on the street as it is probably cleaner and more comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “I'd have been better off in Fawlty Towers”
Reviews.Author: johnhillen
Reviews.Content: A horrendous experience. It was not too expensive but at £40 you are entitled to expect decent standards. My room was dirty, the tv did not work. The bed was dirty and freezing cold. The communal bathroom looked disgusting so i didn't dare to use it. I got out as quickly as i could in the morning. There is no way that this establishment deserves the title 'hotel'. Even 'hostal' would be too generous. I would use the word 'dump.'

Reviews.Title: “No good at all”
Reviews.Author: londonUKfan
Reviews.Content: No friendly service...and one woman seemed to be too shy. The carpet was too old and too dirty. There was a cupboard in my tiny, tiny room but it was too old, too broken and too dirty, with a drawer full of stuff which didn't belong to me! There was a tv...but no remote control. So I asked for one...and got the wrong one...and a laaaarge speech before I got the right one...There were curtains...but is was impossible to close them at night. I was freezing at night...in november and just 1 sheet! Also couldn't sleep because of the thin walls.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting and dirty”
Reviews.Author: krushvillis
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at some budget hotels in my time but nothing as disgusting as this place. Tiny tiny room which still cost 40 pounds a night, filthy carpets covered with patches of other filthy carpets and smelly *bloodstained* covers on the bed. The creepy guy at the front desk took some kind of liking to me because he showed up at my door 5 times in one night with offers to chat or eat expired pudding cups he had bought me from the fridge. The last time he knocked on my door it was almost 1 am and I was so paranoid staying even one night that I piled all my luggage in front of the door so that no one could get in. Do not go here! There are tons of other hotels on the same street that actually cost less and are WAY better.

Reviews.Title: “Big, rude rip off-Made me switch rooms due to their error”
Reviews.Author: VisitingUSAstudent
Reviews.Content: I truly am a very easy going traveler and have stayed in all types of places and never, ever been treated as badly or stayed in a place as bad and rude as this. The front desk man was extremely rude and basically threw a room key at me when I came in. It ends up he gave me the keys to the wrong room and so when I arrived that evening to go to bed was told I had to pack up all my things and move immediately to another room, was told I would be given a discount for my troubles and then they played dumb when I was checking out. On top of that you leave your room keys with them and when I came and went I constantly was being given wrong keys which made going up and down from reception and being looked at like I was a nuisance when it was their error every time. On top of that bathroom was dirty, the maid decided to empty a plastic bag I had in the room with my stuff in it and use it as a trash bag and leave it for me, and a window was left open by the maid so bugs were in there from the trash cans outside my window. Basically probably one of the worst experiences in a hotel ever. I like to usually expect no high level of luxury with getting a hotel so cheap in london but truly i would ward anyone thinking of this place to stay away its not worth any of your money.

Reviews.Title: “total dump!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed there myself. This place is a total scam, I cant believe anyone could post a positive review of this establishment. It was filthy, the toilet was broken and the shower didnt work. I had to pay in advance and couldnt get my money back, I left anyways.

Reviews.Title: “A horrible experience”
Reviews.Author: Jannike
Reviews.Content: I saw the photos and thought it looked lovely, as I really wanted to spend less money this time. It was horrible, horrible. The toilet didn't work, the sink was stuck, there was no cold water as the hane was stuck, it was dirty everywhere, they demanded two nights pay in advance, and an additional 5 pounds for a horrible breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “badest hotel i ever had”
Reviews.Author: Mango
Reviews.Content: * dirty rooms * tiny rooms * thin walls * toilet was working sometimes * the breakfast was a joke * water was coming through the roof * when we complained about the bad situation - after a lenghty discussion, where i started to take some photos, we where threatened with police NEVER AGAIN!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Regency Court Hotel !!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean, comfortable with bright rooms and friendly staff. We stayed at this hotel in room 4, a twin ensuite a few months ago and also in Summer 2003 in a double ensuite and loved it. We are planning another trip to London next year and will be booking in advance here. Great budget hotel with fabulous room rates!!! It has a lovely kitchenette available for guest use 24 hours and feels like home away from home...........:)

Reviews.Title: “beware”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We've just come back from the Regency Court hotel and our experience was as bad as rebel06! We had to pay upfront with a credit card on arrival before we could see the room. It was late, we had little choice - what a mistake at 80 pounds a night! The toilet handle came off in my hand. the shower door fell on my wife. The shower head had not been installed. The bed consisted of a "matress" with 2 springs in it and the pillows were actually used packing material in pillow cases! We had to leave after one night. When we went to check out, we requested a refund for the additional two nights we would not be staying. The response was basically "no refund possible" we insisted and the manager ordered us to leave the hotel. We were insisting on a refund to pay for alternate accomodation elsewhere and she accused us of causing a disturbance and threatened to call the police which we encouraged her to do. The situation was rather tense. The police eventually arrived and took stock of the situation and examined our room. They pointed out to the manager that the room was in violation of building codes and agreed that the manager should refund the balance of our bill -- she still refused claiming that it was not technically possible and that she'd offered us another room and we refused it. We had no choice but to leave this hotel without any refund. This hotel is completely innapropriate and we feel that we have been robbed by its staff. We couldnt sleep, we couldnt wash, we couldnt go to the toilet, and the staff was abusive and threatening. All for 80 pounds a night!

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the Regency Court Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our first stay in London was to be the Regency Court Hotel in Earls Court. What a disaster! Budget accommodation is certainly the description I would give for this accommodation. Upon arrival, we were requested to pay cash for the accommodation we had booked when in fact, the funds had already been taken from the Visa card provided. The accommodation was definitely not up to standard and accordingly we left the premises immediately. We offered to pay the cancellation fee (one night), but it was refused. On continuing the holiday it was noticed that further funds had been taken out of the account - funds that are still to be recovered. Beware of staying at this accommodation place - definitely not somewhere I would recommend.

HotelInfo.Name: Regency Court Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 14 Penywern Road, London SW5 9ST, England
